title: Alfven Waves
subtitle: How magnetic waves shape solar wind speeds
description: Alfven waves propagating through the solar wind continuously deposit energy into the plasma, accelerating it during its journey from the Sun to Earth. Speed distributions reveal that fast solar wind receives an additional 100+ km/s boost from wave forcing, explaining why observed speeds exceed predictions from thermal expansion alone.

related_figures.relevance: Demonstrates how kinetic energy measured near the Sun by Parker Solar Probe predicts speeds at Earth, validating that wave-driven acceleration is complete by 0.2 AU

related_topics.connection: Both describe how solar wind evolves during its journey to Earth

paper.title: Characterizing the Impact of Alfven Wave Forcing in Interplanetary Space on the Distribution of Near-Earth Solar Wind Speeds
